bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1925

div1.p: Read reports on the San Salvador yellow fever cases.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 19, 1925
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH
LABORATORY SERVICE
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
JOHN G. FITZGERALD
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
NORMA S. THOMPSON
SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
January 19, 1925
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed for your information
copies of a letter from Dr. Connor dated San Salvador,
December 24, 1924, and of the accompanying reports as fol-
lows:
Summary of cases of yellow fever in Salvador,
1918 to October, 1924
Dates of cases of yellow fever in Salvador,
December, 1918 - January, 1920 inclusive
Summary of cases in Salvador from June 5 to October
25, 1924
Confirmed cases of yellow fever during 1920
Reports concerning the yellow fever situation in 1920.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Dr. H. R. Carter
2122 California Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FMR:EP E5
